name: 1.2 - Dial Before You Dig (DBYD) and Permit to Excavate completed and signed onto by personnel
1.3 - Confirmation of Scope and Extent of Works with Project Team, including RCC and BySC
1.5 - Traffic Control – TGS approved and appropriately selected for the works
2.1 - Minor clearing of vegetation undertaken – where applicable.
2.2 - Demolition works / Spoil Removal undertaken and spoil removed from site to Quirks Quarry.
2.3 - HOLD POINT: If unsuitable is encountered BYSC to be notified prior to works continuing
2.4 - Table drains shaped to allow water to flow freely and best marry into existing surfaces.
3.1 - HOLD POINT: Proof roll subgrade: If foundation fails BySC to be notified and to provided direction
3.2 - Road base Material: Material source along with conforming material NATA test certificates have been submitted and approved by the Principal (Material Stockpile Lot)

3.3 - If testing required - Layers compacted to 100% Standard compaction for full formation width. Compaction testing to be done 1 test per 500m2, minimum of 3 test taken at a time (per lot) or as directed otherwise.
3.4 - Deep lift CTB of minimum 2.8% @ 150mm required
3.5 - HOLD POINT – Carry out a proof roll of finished pavement where applicable
4.1 - Geotextile – A34 Geotextile separator placed prior to rock placement IF DIRECTED or WITHIN SCOPE
4.2 - Rock Placement - Rock to be placed in completed drain profile as per agreed scope.
○ Existing rock to be grouted as per agreed scope.
○ Rocks to be cleaned down at end of grouting for neat finish
○ Suitable subgrade material and prepared to suitable surface

○ Dimensions and positions of forms shall be carefully checked after the forms are erected. Forms shall be aligned accurately and the location of all fittings, hold formers etc. checked prior to placing of concrete.
○ Placing of reinforcement as per agreed scope, with reference to Typical Construction Details. Reinforcement to maintain a 50mm vertical and horizontal cover unless directed otherwise.

5.2.3 - HOLD POINT – PRE-POUR INSPECTION The formwork shall be inspected by the Superintendent, and the placing of reinforcement in the spaces formed, where specified, shall not commence until the formwork is approved by the Superintendent.
REMARKS - BySC Approval: Send photos to BySC PM of rock armouring prior to pouring of concrete
○ The concrete shall be mixed and delivered in accordance with the requirements of AS 1379 relating to: -

○ The freshly placed concrete compacted by continuous spading, slicing or by vibrator units. Exposed surfaces of the concrete shall be struck off and finished with a wooden float. Corners and edges should be as per the drawings.
○ Surfaces are floated, finished and cured as required to a quality finish. Broom finish as required.
7.1 - SITE HANDOVER: All works complete, demobilised and site handed back to BySC
7.2 - Verify conformance including close out of NCR’s
7.3 - Damage No. (DM) signed off and closed by PM or representative
